S. excJushel7 by The Baod-McNallJ eanfers• Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis Dfredor under th au In Pittsburgh Columbia National Bank Columbia National Bank is lo~ated ~n the very center of Pittsburgh's financial and commercial. activities. Fourth Avenue is the street of finance, Wood street is a commercial artery and Columbia stands at the intersection. For thirty years it has served Pittsburgh customers and the ever-widening circle of its influence keeps it in touch with the manifold business activities of the community. The Directors of the institution are prominent in Pittsburgh commercial life and familiar with industrial conditions throughout the country. The Officers are trained banking men who realize that prompt collection of drafts, checks and foreign bills of exchange mean the greater use of capital. Adequate facilities have been provided for prompt service along these lines and the institution invites you to make use of these facilities. DIRECTORS James B. Haines, E. H. Jennings E.W.
